employees.notes: Proff lists 779 employees for Speira AS (register snapshot on the company page, year not explicitly stated for this headcount). [1]

revenue.notes: Proff reports operating revenue (Sum driftsinntekter) of 7,087,560 in NOK-thousands format for 2024. [1]

company.entity_resolution_notes: Entity resolved as Norwegian legal company SPEIRA AS (org.nr. 975 934 578) via Proff. Speira’s 2024 Transparency Act statement confirms Speira AS is one of the two Speira Norway operating companies and has facilities in Holmestrand and Karmøy. [1][2]

srm_assessment.overall_summary: Speira AS uses recycled aluminium scrap as an inbound production input, with Holmestrand described as producing rolled aluminium products based on remelting recycled and primary aluminium, and 'almost exclusively' on scrap plus ingot metal in the transparency statement. However, full company-wide actual SRM input tonnage is not disclosed in the located sources. [2][3]

srm_inputs.label: Recycled aluminium scrap
srm_inputs.used_for: Input feed for remelting/casting in the Holmestrand foundry to produce rolled aluminium products. [2][3]
srm_inputs.tier_reasoning: Evidence indicates substantial use at Holmestrand (including language that production there is almost exclusively based on remelting aluminium scrap and ingot metal), but the legal entity has multiple sites and no audited company-wide SRM input share/tonnage is provided in the retrieved set. [2][3][4]

other_quantities.context: Company press communication states the new Holmestrand furnace will add 22,000 tons scrap intake per year; this is a forward-looking increase, not reported historical actual use. [4]

share.context: Press communication says around half of Holmestrand production will be based on recycled scrap after the new furnace project. [4]

srm_inputs.volume_notes: No source found with current, company-level actual annual SRM input mass for Speira AS; available quantified figures are forward-looking site-level statements for Holmestrand. [4]
srm_inputs.uncertainties: The transparency statement is common reporting context for Speira AS and Speira Recycling Services Norway AS, and the strongest scrap-use wording is site-specific (Holmestrand). Forward-looking figures may change as the furnace project progresses. [2][4]

gaps_and_uncertainties: No retrieved annual report/ESG dataset provided audited, current-year company-level tonnes of recycled scrap input for Speira AS alone. [2][4]
Permit-hearing text confirms recycled aluminium remelting and expected higher scrap intake, but does not provide realized annual SRM mass for the legal entity. [3]
